DataElement.preferredName: Local-Regional Urothelial Neoplasm Additional Surgery Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether additional surgery for a new urothelial tumor event was done.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Affecting only a restricted part or area of the body.__Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra._(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth._Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.__Added; extra; further.A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Local-Regional; affecting only a restricted part or area of the body.:Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.
Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
